settings.name: Breeding
settings.description: On by default. Here you can choose if the Beekeeper will breed bees.

settings.name: Honeycombs or Honey
settings.description: Here you choose if the Beekeeper will collect honeycombs, honey bottles, or both. They will collect whatever shows on the GUI.

settings.name: Recipe Mode
settings.description: This is unlocked by researching Warehouse Master in the University.  This allows you to change the order the hut chooses when it knows more than one recipe for an item.

options.name: Priority
options.description: This is the default setting. The hut will try to use the recipe that is higher up in their recipe list first.

options.name: Warehouse Stock
options.description: The hut will look in the warehouse first to see what resource you have more of before deciding what recipe it will use.

settings.name: Task
settings.description: This is where you can choose if you want the Guard to patrol, follow, or guard.

options.name: Patrol
options.description: The guard will patrol an area you designate in Patrol Settings.

options.name: Guard
options.description: You can set one area for the Guard to stay in. When you click "Set Target", you will be taken to the Selection Tools tab, where you can get the the Guard Scepter and designate the guard location.

options.name: Follow
options.description: The guard will follow you around as your personal bodyguard, protecting you or fighting alongside you. They will even go outside the colony when following! You can designate how they follow you in Follow Settings.

settings.name: Retreat on low health
settings.description: Here you can choose if the Guard will attempt to retreat when they have low health.

settings.name: Hire Trainee
settings.description: If there is a vacancy at this tower, a new Knight or Archer can be hired from the respective training facility (Archery for Archers and Combat Academy for knights) instead of an unemployed colonist. This setting only matters if Assign Colonists to Jobs is turned to Automatic in the Town Hall GUI.

settings.name: Patrol Mode
settings.description: This is where you can choose how you want the Guard to patrol.

options.name: Automatic
options.description: The Guard will patrol from hut to hut and back to their tower. They will only patrol huts within the patrol range of their tower.

options.name: Manual
options.description: You can set the patrol route when you click on Set Positions. You will be taken to the Selection Tools tab, where you can get the the Guard Scepter and designate patrol positions for the Guard to patrol between. To delete patrol positions, simply get a new Guard Scepter and click a new patrol position. The old ones should disappear.

settings.name: Follow Mode
settings.description: This is where you can choose how you want the Guard to follow you. If you choose Loose Grouping, the Guard will stay close to you, but not as close as if you choose Tight Grouping.

settings.name: Recipe Mode
settings.description: This is unlocked by researching Warehouse Master in the University.  This allows you to change the order the hut chooses when it knows more than one recipe for an item.

options.name: Priority
options.description: This is the default setting. The hut will try to use the recipe that is higher up in their recipe list first.

options.name: Warehouse Stock
options.description: The hut will look in the warehouse first to see what resource you have more of before deciding what recipe it will use.

settings.name: Builder Mode
settings.description: Here you can set your Builder to Manual or Automatic mode (Automatic by default). In Automatic, the builder chooses which build order they'll complete next themselves (based on the order of the build requests in the Town Hall GUI's work orders tab). In Manual, you choose their next build order yourself by clicking Select next to the build order's name.

settings.name: Recipe Mode
settings.description: This is unlocked by researching Warehouse Master in the University.  This allows you to change the order the hut chooses when it knows more than one recipe for an item.

options.name: Priority
options.description: This is the default setting. The hut will try to use the recipe that is higher up in their recipe list first.

options.name: Warehouse Stock
options.description: The hut will look in the warehouse first to see what resource you have more of before deciding what recipe it will use.

settings.name: Build Method
settings.description: This is unlocked by researching Builder Modes in the University.  This allows you to change how the builder builds, reducing pathfinding and speeding up builds (especially large builds).  Any one of these can be set in the structurize config, but once the "Builder Modes" research is done in the university, the one set here takes precedence.

options.name: default
options.description: The default row-by-row pattern.

options.name: inwardcircle
options.description: Blocks are placed like a square spiral from the outside in.

options.name: inwardcircleheight#
options.description: This will also make spirals from the outside in, but each spiral gets built upward 1 to 4 times, before the builder will start the next square inward.

options.name: hilbert
options.description: hilbert does this pattern, with a little difference to work for rectangular areas.

options.name: random
options.description: Blocks are placed in an entirely random order. Note that this slows down builds.

settings.name: Fill Block
settings.description: Here you can select what block the builder uses to fill in holes/gaps in the schematic.  The default is the dirt block.

settings.name: Breeding
settings.description: On by default. Here you can choose if the farmer will breed (and consequently kill) chickens.

settings.name: Feeding
settings.description: On by default. Here you can choose if the farmer will feed baby animals, to let them grow up faster.

settings.name: Produce Dirt
settings.description: Turning this on will make dirt instead of compost.  It also occassionally produces podzol.

settings.name: Min Warehouse Stock
settings.description: This is the minimum number of an item to be left in the warehouse before the hut will request and compost other items.  The default is 16.

settings.name: Recipe Mode
settings.description: This is unlocked by researching Warehouse Master in the University.  This allows you to change the order the hut chooses when it knows more than one recipe for an item.

options.name: Priority
options.description: This is the default setting. The hut will try to use the recipe that is higher up in their recipe list first.

options.name: Warehouse Stock
options.description: The hut will look in the warehouse first to see what resource you have more of before deciding what recipe it will use.

settings.name: Breeding
settings.description: On by default. Here you can choose if the Cowhand will breed (and consequently kill) cows.

settings.name: Feeding
settings.description: On by default. Here you can choose if the Cowhand will feed baby animals, to let them grow up faster.

settings.name: Milking
settings.description: Off by default. When on, you provide the Cowhand with as many empty buckets as you like. In return, they will milk the cows and give you back buckets of milk.

settings.name: Recipe Mode
settings.description: This is unlocked by researching Warehouse Master in the University.  This allows you to change the order the hut chooses when it knows more than one recipe for an item.

options.name: Priority
options.description: This is the default setting. The hut will try to use the recipe that is higher up in their recipe list first.

options.name: Warehouse Stock
options.description: The hut will look in the warehouse first to see what resource you have more of before deciding what recipe it will use.

settings.name: Item
settings.description: Here you can set what item you want the Crusher to make. (See the above lists.)

settings.name: Daily Limit
settings.description: This setting allows you to further limit the number of blocks that can be crushed in a day.  The maximum is set by the hut level (see above).

settings.name: Recipe Mode
settings.description: This is unlocked by researching Warehouse Master in the University.  This allows you to change the order the hut chooses when it knows more than one recipe for an item.

options.name: Priority
options.description: This is the default setting. The hut will try to use the recipe that is higher up in their recipe list first.

options.name: Warehouse Stock
options.description: The hut will look in the warehouse first to see what resource you have more of before deciding what recipe it will use.

settings.name: Request Fertilizer
settings.description: On by default.  This lets you choose whether the Farmer will request fertilizer.

settings.name: Recipe Mode
settings.description: This is unlocked by researching Warehouse Master in the University.  This allows you to change the order the hut chooses when it knows more than one recipe for an item.

options.name: Priority
options.description: This is the default setting. The hut will try to use the recipe that is higher up in their recipe list first.

options.name: Warehouse Stock
options.description: The hut will look in the warehouse first to see what resource you have more of before deciding what recipe it will use.

settings.description: This is unlocked by researching Warehouse Master in the University.  This allows you to change the order the hut chooses when it knows more than one recipe for an item.

options.name: Priority
options.description: This is the default setting. The hut will try to use the recipe that is higher up in their recipe list first.

options.name: Warehouse Stock
options.description: The hut will look in the warehouse first to see what resource you have more of before deciding what recipe it will use.

settings.name: Replanting
settings.description: Where you can select if you want the Forester to replant trees that are chopped down. They will only do this if they have enough saplings.

settings.name: Zoning Mode
settings.description: This lets you turn on or off if you want the Forester to be restricted to a certain area when chopping trees. To choose the area, use the Obtain Tool button on the next tab.

settings.name: Recipe Mode
settings.description: This is unlocked by researching Warehouse Master in the University.  This allows you to change the order the hut chooses when it knows more than one recipe for an item.

options.name: Priority
options.description: This is the default setting. The hut will try to use the recipe that is higher up in their recipe list first.

options.name: Warehouse Stock
options.description: The hut will look in the warehouse first to see what resource you have more of before deciding what recipe it will use.

settings.description: This is unlocked by researching Warehouse Master in the University.  This allows you to change the order the hut chooses when it knows more than one recipe for an item.

options.description: This is the default setting. The hut will try to use the recipe that is higher up in their recipe list first.

options.description: The hut will look in the warehouse first to see what resource you have more of before deciding what recipe it will use.

settings.description: This is where you can choose if you want the Guard to patrol, follow, or guard.

options.name: Patrol Mine
options.description: The Guard will patrol the level of a Mine. You must also assign that level in the Mine GUI.

This setting only matters if Assign Colonists to Jobs is turned to Automatic in the Town Hall GUI.

settings.name: Fill Block
settings.description: Here you can select what block the Miner uses to fill in holes/gaps in the Mine.  The default is the cobblestone block.

settings.name: Max Depth
settings.description: Here you can overide the default maximum depth of the Mine, if you don't want the Miner to dig as deep as the Mine level allows.  The default is -100 (minus sign is not visible in the window).

settings.name: Recipe Mode
settings.description: This is unlocked by researching Warehouse Master in the University.  This allows you to change the order the hut chooses when it knows more than one recipe for an item.

options.name: Priority
options.description: This is the default setting. The hut will try to use the recipe that is higher up in their recipe list first.

options.name: Warehouse Stock
options.description: The hut will look in the warehouse first to see what resource you have more of before deciding what recipe it will use.

settings.name: Close portal on return
settings.description: Tells the Nether Miner whether to close the portal or not when they return.  Default is On.

settings.name: Crops
settings.description: You can select the plant you want the Planter to grow. Just click the button to cycle through sugar cane, bamboo, or cactus.  **Note:** If you have completed the Double Trouble research in the University (which lets the Planter plant two crops at a time), this button will also show options for *two* crops.

settings.name: Breeding
settings.description: On by default. Here you can choose if the Rabbit Herder will breed (and consequently kill) rabbits.

settings.name: Feeding
settings.description: On by default. Here you can choose if the Rabbit Herder will feed baby animals, to let them grow up faster.

settings.name: Breeding
settings.description: On by default. Here you can choose if the Shepherd will breed (and consequently kill) sheep.

settings.name: Feeding
settings.description: On by default. Here you can choose if the Shepherd will feed baby animals, to let them grow up faster.

settings.name: Dyeing
settings.description: On by default. Here you choose if the Shepherd will dye sheep random colors to get differently colored wool. (They do not require dye to do this.)

settings.name: Shearing
settings.description: On by default. Here you can choose if the Shepherd will shear the sheep or not.
